Text:
If the `username` doesn't match then there's not much point checking whether `password` matches, so that's a perfectly good way to do it. You could shorten it to:

    if username == "brian0306" && password == "secret" {
        println("❤️")
    } else {
        println("Uh oh, your username or password is wrong!")
    }

However that isn't going to tell you whether the `username` or `password` is correct.

If the `username` doesn't match then there's not much point checking whether `password` matches, so that's a perfectly good way to do it. You could shorten it to:

    if username == "brian0306" && password == "secret" {
        println("❤️")
    } else {
        println("Uh oh, your username or password is wrong!")
    }

However that isn't going to tell you which field was incorrect (`username` and/or `password`).
